fields.description: Steal the UI from JIRA - at the moment we can't see what's inside the Mail Queue.
fields.summary: Display Mail Queue in the administration section

fields.description:
At the moment the administration of mail servers is very confusing. 

It uses a portion of the setup wizard to do it's work, which doesn't work well from a user perspective. We need to write dedicated adminstration actions here.

We need to make the following changes:
- when you click mail servers, a page should show the details of all configured mail servers - both POP and SMTP. 
- each mail server should have an edit link next to it, to edit it's settings (see JIRA for an example of the UI)
- this _list of servers_ you should also have 'add POP server' and 'add SMTP server' links, which allow you to add a new POP or SMTP servers.

To recreate-
1. edit a page
2. Preview page
3. click re-edit page
4. now the page just displays 'content'!!!
fields.summary: Lost content when editing a page

fields.description: The changes to how versioning of objects works has broken revert page. We need to fix it. This is also related to CONF-318.
We need to check the versioning of these classes (I'm pretty sure it's broken right now with the recent changes) and fix the usages.
fields.summary: Fix and test versioning of EmailTemplate and PageTemplate

fields.description: We should remove this method and convert all usages of it to the new format.
We must run through all of the test plans on the standalone version before shipping A3.

There are a few problems with the page information screen:

a) External and internal outgoing links aren't separated. We can have them in one list (outgoing links) but external links should be postfixed with the external link icon (like they are in the page content).

b) Internal links are displayed the same whether or not they exist. If the destination page does not exist we should print it in red with a + sign etc (again like in the page content) and then link to the _create page_ not the _display page_.

At the moment only page contents are searchable. It would be useful to be able to search attached files (specifically text, PDF and Word documents). 

We can use PDFBox (http://www.pdfbox.org) to index PDF documents. I haven't found solutions for Word docs yet, perhaps Apache POI?

fields.description:
We should convert all of the queries in our DAO objects to named queries stored in the hibernate mapping files. These are easier to edit, and also we should use named parameters for them.

I've converted two of the DAOs to test it (EmailTemplate and OutgoingLink) - let's convert the others when we get time.
fields.summary: Convert DAO queries to named queries

fields.description: In the UI, wherever there's information about a user, the username is used. It would be nice to at least have an option to show the full name instead. The username is not that interesting.
fields.summary: Show full name instead of username

fields.description:
There are still major problems with pages that use international characters (in my case swedish å, ä, ö) in the name.

It is possible to create a page with these characters, and it works great to view the page through clicking on links in other pages.

What doesn't work is this:

The link to the page in the "Recently updates pages".
The link to the page in the space summary.
The link in the breadcrumbs navigation.
Editing the page works up to the point where the edited page should be displayed.

Basically, with a page called "Utsökningar", the url /display/test/Utsökningar works, but /display/test/Uts%F6kningar doesn't.

Renaming the page results in a NullPointer at com.atlassian.confluence.persistence.confluence.ConfluencePersistenceManager.save(ConfluencePersistenceManager.java:62)
An extra bonus is that the referencing links gets renamed, but not the page. A transaction seems to be needed.
A tool that fires up a popup to allow a user to search for the page they want to link to.

We want to have a list of commonly used syntax and perhaps a "more ..." link that opens up a popup that displays all the categories of wiki syntax available. The user can then expand the category they want to explore further.
fields.summary: Add Wiki Syntax help to create page

fields.summary: Exception when exporting whole space to PDF
Ability to sort lists of pages by update time, creator, etc.

fields.description: On the "Space Summary" page, the "Last Mod. Date" field is labeled "Last Modifier", whereas the "Last Modifier" field is labeled "Last Mod. Date"--the labels need to be swapped.
fields.summary: Field labels switched in Space Summary

fields.description: It would be really nice to be able to move a page from one space to another, similar to the way you can move an issue from one project to another in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to move a pages between spaces

fields.description: At the very least to the Jira level ( Icon ,Welcome message  ,major colours )

Need to be able to refer to a page attachment inline 
( within the page wiki markup )

Other wise if I Have n attachments with same name ( very common for us )

they are just uselessly attached at the bottom of the page...
fields.summary: Need a way to link to page attachments within page.

fields.description:
create a new page , click on the single hot referrer link ,
doh !
fields.summary: first hot referrer link is to the create action - doh !

fields.description:
Looking at the page history, there are a few problems :

there is a link to "Changes to previous" for v.1  !
which I'm reasonably certain didn't have a previous version, where as the latest version , has no such link....

It should either be "changes to next" or even better moved up one in the table.

||ID||Feature||
|#|Special bit|
|#|Special token|

The numbering normally done by using hashes doens't work when embedded in a table

fields.description:
My Confluence server occasionally just stops responding.  I have to shutdown and start it again to make it work.

Today I tried getting to the bottom of it.  Since it's intermittent, I thought it might have to do with the page indexing system.  So I did a manual re-index.

Running top on the server showed this:
 6331 root      25   0 73288  71M 14896 S    98.8  3.5   1:26   0 java

Basically, that Java process was using all available CPU power (P4 2.4GHz).  It did that for a few minutes until it died and the server stopped responding.

While this bug persists, Confluence is unusable for me.

fields.summary: / in a link name stuffs the referring link

fields.description:
It would be useful in many circumstances to be able to define parent/child relationships between pages. 

The simplest way to do this is to specify a 'parent' for any page.

This information would be useful in creating a better taxonomy of pages. This could mean creating better index pages, better breadcrumbs (parent > child > grandchild) as well as directories of pages.
When you rename a page, links within other pages get renamed but not links in other places (ie comment bodies or space descriptions).

I think we're doing far more SQL queries than we need to.

We should look into improving the performance of Confluence by looking first at the SQL queries we run, and eliminating unneeded queries by using Hibernate's caching where possible. I think we'll get a huge speed boost from this one thing.

It would be nice to have a page that displays a summary containing:
(a) a list of all incoming/outgoing links
(b) a list of all referral links
(c) a list of attachments

The current Confluence page does display some of the above, but it would  be better to have a separate summary page that displays the above only. 

Cheers, 
Mike & Dave
We should always use the most recent stable version of Hibernate, especially during the 2.1 beta series.

At the moment the naming of links is confusing. 

InternalLinks are really OutgoingLinks (links from a source page to another page, or a remote URL).

ExternalLinks are really ReferralLinks (links from a remote URL to a destination page - not a 'source page' as currently).

Are these names/assumptions correct?

How hard is it to change these names everywhere?

when you choose Administaration, you get a grop of RHS menus
(Features,Security) as soon as you select one , they go away.

They shold be there for all the admin screens.
fields.summary: Admin screens need to keep the rhs menu

fields.description:
Having the whole site backed up in A1, and trying to restore it somewhere else on a "clean" (newly setup) A2 version causes SaxParserException and some NPEs. Although the application says that everything has been restored successfully (seems the exception is catched without any proper reaction) but the whole site is unusable then (all corrupted db)! You can not even login since the previous data have been deleted to restore the new ones (which has been unsuccessful then).

I guess the problem is that the backup XML format (the table structures and even data formats) are different in A1 and A2 so the restore module gets into problems. On the other hand, it's not correct to blindly restore the whole table structures and data. They may be different (which is so in our case) so a migration is needed from the old to new format both from table structure and data format point of view.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to specify a link to an attached document in the page text.  I can make the link external and type in the actual confluence URL to the attachment but thats a pain.  It would be nice to just specify something like:

[attachment:myattachment.doc]

So when I'm refering to an attachment in the text I can put the link right there...
fields.summary: Ability to add a link to the attachment in the text of the page

fields.description:
On some of my pages, "incoming links" are duplicated (two times the same link with the same description).
I'll try to reproduce it and add a comment.

Maybe it occurs after editing the source page of the link several times.

(See attachment)
Reading US-style date/time formats is cumbersome when you are not used to it. Please make the date format configurable and allow 24h time (instead of am/pm)

The folks I have shown Confluence to simply love it.
So as is so great, I have to ask (as with JIRA) for support for external  group support. (that is LDAP in our case)
This would make Confluence a lot more usable (at least for us).

Within JIRA, I am already manually maintaining ~10 groups. I really don't want to do this _again_ with confluence.

If there is a constraint in resources, can we contribute code?
fields.summary: Please please please. Support external (LDAP) groups.

fields.description:
We've created a page with a "ü" (German U Umlaut). Althouht this page can be cerated and the page name is displayed in the space, an attempt to follow the link fails.

This is bad, as at least germans would expect this to work. ;-)
fields.summary: Page Names may not contain non ASCII chars.

fields.description:
It is possble to create a page that has a colon in the title, but it is impossible to link to it.

I see two solutions: Either make it possible to link to a page with a colon in the title (using a \: notation or something) or make it impossible to create a page with the colon in the title.

fields.description:
All of the sudden I can't log in anymore.  I'm always getting invalid userid or password.  I was going to try to setup a new user and see if I could log in with a new account but then I got an exception.  It looked like a hibernate exception saying the database was already in use by another process....

I just restarted Tomcat and now I can log in... hmm.. weird one.

It should be possible to define a hierarchical category, and assign each page some category from the category set. Of course, all pages in category (recursive/not recursive) should be presented by system.

I've set up confluence with a tomcat context of "/cf" instead of "/".
(I have to, because of our proxies).

So I went ahead and modiefied the web-app context and confluence.cfg, namely the domain to be "the right URL".

But if a new user signs up, he is redirected to the wrong URL:
http://<old-domain>/dashboard.action instead of https://<new domain>/cf/dashboard.action.
Maybe the value is also stored in the DB?

When I made a new space, the default content was: This is the home page for 'UCW' space.

You can edit the content of this page using the "Edit" link on the right. In IE 6, this renders as "'UCW'". That's because the ' entity is only defined in XHTML, not previous HTML DTDs: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-html/2001Aug/0075.html But there's no indication that the page is XHTML if that's the intent. To be XHTML there must be an XML header indicating so. And I'm sure there's plenty of non-compliant code on the page. Even in the short snippet above, the paragraph tag isn't balanced. I'd love to see Confluence XHTML-compliant, but until then you should use ' instead.

When I create new pages, I get 2 emails, one with the real name of the new page, the other says this:

Page $context.page.title created!

fields.summary: Paragraph filter  is running over {code} blocks and screwing them up too

fields.description:
For example, the following block will be converted to preformmatted block from the first '{{{' to the end of last '}}}' which is wrong:

{{{ this is just some part of code }}} but no _this part_ and again {{{ some more code here }}}

CamelCase words are turned into links in preformatted blocks (when CamelCase support is ON)!
Nothing in preformmatted blocks should get formatted!

The same story for "{code}" blocks...

The {{{ and }}} filters shold be multiline. At the moment they only work on a single line. Nothing in between should be processed at all.

Make sure we write multiple unit tests for this.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-208].
  {panel}

We would like to have :

* Reusable sub page components (portlets) some provided by atlassian, some written by us ( We can't wait for you to do all the work , and neither can you :-)

* All portlets should be user editable - made of html + velocity a la roller

* Flexible Interactive Page Layout - Similar to the JIRA dashboard
some pre defined e.g Dashboard, Wiki, Space Home,...

* Customisable Navigation - Both meta data driven , and static using a hand written nav portlet

* Multiple built-in sub-page(portlet) types ( RSS Agg, Calendar , Free Form ) ( as mentioned above they should still be user editable, and be htnl+velocity based )

Attached is a mockup of the portlet based dashboard .
